result.execSummary:
The defendant Solomon Charles Trice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Misdemeanor Conviction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

*NO firearms; weapons.
*Due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*No contact with Tammy S. without approval of the court.

*Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
*Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: *Up-front condition time to be served at HOC.

charges.descr: Intentionally Contact - Order for Misdemeanor Conviction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Solomon Charles Trice

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 27 days time served, consecutive to any other sentence.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years. Court ordered 45 days of up-front condition time to be served at the House of Corrections. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for zero days time served, consecutive to any other sentence.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years. Court ordered 45 days of up-front condition time, consecutive to count 1, to be served at the House of Corrections.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with Tammy S. without approval of the court.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Solomon Charles Trice in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Solomon Charles Trice in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Solomon Charles Trice not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea and sentencing.  Court is in trial and cannot hear the matter.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Solomon Charles Trice not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defendant would like to enter a plea.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Solomon Charles Trice not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TAMMY S.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Solomon Charles Trice in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Solomon Charles Trice in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
